posts.post_content:
This card is really sick. Just play it in a mono green deck using Prismatic Omen and some good creatures, and your opponents are just about dead by turn 5 !  
  
Waaay better than Cruel Ultimatum. and it even increases in power as you put more lands into play! Awesome with the new Landfall mechanic :)

Posted By: xd4 (3/19/2010 12:02:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Guys, this card is amazing. My preferred deck style is 5 color, and this card has proven to be extremely efficient, even to the point of mopping my superfriends deck to the floor. I ran into the discarding issue when i ran this card recently, and eldrazi may be the way to fix that. also, when yu combine this card with cards like maelstrom nexus and prismatic omen, yu can really rush things out, especially if yu cascade into a land rush card. other cards that break this card are walk the aeons and dawnglow infusion, keeping yourself alive until you set up for the big kill.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
The only thing wrong with this card is the fact that you discard as many cards as you draw, meaning that if it's the last card in your hand, you basically mill yourself and draw nothing.
  
   
And why do people say it kills on turn 5 with Omen ? 2x5 = 10, not 20. Unless I'm missing something.
posts.html:

And why do people say it kills on turn 5 with Omen ? 2x5 = 10, not 20. Unless I'm missing something.

Posted By: Belz_ (4/21/2010 5:22:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Esprel's right, actually. If you use this card the way it was printed to be used (with one or two of each land type) it's actually pretty underwhelming. Maybe magic's just come a long way since Apocalypse, but nowadays I expect [a lot more](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=185136) when I pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}.   
  
Ironically, a modern enchantment, Prismatic Omen, raised this card up to the force to be reckoned with that its name and cost suggests it should be. With [Prismatic Omen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prismatic Omen) in play, by the time you can play Last Stand you will have at *least* +10 life, target player loses 10 life, 5 damage to target creature, 5 1/1 saprolings in play, and draw/discard 5 cards.   
  
That'll pretty much give you the game in most cases. If the 10 life loss doesn't end the game outright, the saprolings and life gain should keep you alive long enough to use the second one (or another bomb) you probably just drew.
posts.html:
Esprel's right, actually. If you use this card the way it was printed to be used (with one or two of each land type) it's actually pretty underwhelming. Maybe magic's just come a long way since Apocalypse, but nowadays I expect a lot more when I pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}.

Ironically, a modern enchantment, Prismatic Omen, raised this card up to the force to be reckoned with that its name and cost suggests it should be. With Prismatic Omen in play, by the time you can play Last Stand you will have at least +10 life, target player loses 10 life, 5 damage to target creature, 5 1/1 saprolings in play, and draw/discard 5 cards.

That'll pretty much give you the game in most cases. If the 10 life loss doesn't end the game outright, the saprolings and life gain should keep you alive long enough to use the second one (or another bomb) you probably just drew.

Posted By: ScissorsLizard (4/19/2010 12:45:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
4x Sakura Tribe-Elder  
4x Search for Tomorrow  
4x Tribal Flames  
4x Worldly Council  
4x Matca Rioters  
4x Maelstrom Archangel  
1x Progenitus  
3x Last Stand  
2x Violent Ultimatum  
2x Cruel Ultimatum  
4x Prismatic Omen  
24x lands (primarily forests)  
  
It works. Free-casting Proggy off an Archangel is scary. Casting Last Stand with the Omen out is scarier usually, because it's generally game-ending - average of 14 damage, and that's a dead creature, 14 life, 7 saprolings, and most likely another something scary in my hand from the seven cards drawn.
